items.title: Decreased glucose metabolism in medial prefrontal areas is associated with nutritional status in patients with prodromal and early Alzheimer's disease
items.summary: A new study shows that hypometabolism in the medial prefrontal areas is specifically associated with Alzheimer's disease-related nutritional problems, and decrease in fat mass may have a key role.

alternate.title: Decreased glucose metabolism in medial prefrontal areas is associated with nutritional status in patients with prodromal and early Alzheimer's disease

thumbnail.title: Decreased glucose metabolism in medial prefrontal areas is associated with nutritional status in patients with prodromal and early Alzheimer's disease

items.title: Medical students not trained to prescribe medical marijuana
items.summary: More than half of the states in the US now allow some type of legal marijuana use, primarily medical marijuana. But, in a survey of medical residents and deans at the nation's medical schools, researchers have found that the majority of schools are not teaching their students about medical marijuana, and the majority of students don't feel prepared to discuss the subject with patients.

alternate.title: Medical students not trained to prescribe medical marijuana

items.title: Brain halves increase communication to compensate for aging, study finds
items.summary: Increased communication between distant brain regions helps older adults compensate for the negative aspects of aging, reports a new study.

alternate.title: Brain halves increase communication to compensate for aging, study finds

items.title: Chemotherapy pain could be eased by jetlag drug, study suggests
items.summary: Painful side effects from cancer medicines could be tackled with a drug that eases the effects of jetlag, research suggests.

alternate.title: Chemotherapy pain could be eased by jetlag drug, study suggests

items.title: New study on the placebo effect and antidepressants in children and adolescents
items.summary: Although the clinical efficacy of antidepressants in children and adolescents is proven, it is frequently accompanied by side effects. In addition, the influence of the placebo effect on the efficacy of antidepressants is unclear. A meta-analysis of data from over 6,500 patients has now shown that, although antidepressants are more effective than placebos, the difference is minor and varies according to the type of mental disorder.

alternate.title: New study on the placebo effect and antidepressants in children and adolescents
